messages.content:
{"mitigation_clause": "Profit-Sharing. The parties shall share net profits from the JV in proportion to their respective capital contributions, currently 60% to Party A and 40% to Party B, with adjustments annually. 

**Net Profit Definition:** Net profit shall mean gross revenue less only the following items: (i) direct operating expenses expressly attributable to the JV, (ii) bona fide taxes, and (iii) approved capitalized costs. All other deductions shall be disclosed and approved by both parties.

**Audit Rights:** Each party shall have the right, upon reasonable notice, to audit the books and records used to calculate net profit, at its own expense, no more than once per fiscal year.

**Performance Thresholds:** If the JV’s EBITDA falls below $5,000,000 in a fiscal year, the profit‑sharing percentages shall be adjusted to 55%/45% respectively until EBITDA exceeds the threshold for two consecutive years.

**Dispute Resolution:** Any disagreement over profit calculations shall be resolved by binding arbitration under the rules of the American Arbitration Association.","explanation": "The added definitions clarify profit calculations, audit rights allow verification, and performance thresholds prevent disproportionate payouts in low‑profit periods, collectively reducing litigation risk."}

Here’s a summary of the analysis:

- **Mitigation Suggestion:** The revised clause above adds a precise net‑profit definition, audit rights, performance thresholds, and a dispute‑resolution clause.
